MajorClaims.Text: I prefer the project members to work in person rather them by email

Claims.Text: this means help to achieve a good communication
discussion face to face in a meeting is much better than by emails
less misunderstanding leads to less conflicts and fights, and enhance the communication amongst the team members
emails are not convenient for the work but it is better than none
work in person will be more efficient

we should realize that in a project, there are numerous coordination works are required, if each opinion is communicated via email, there will be hundreds or thousands of emails there that we know this is not a good experience

Premises.Text: team members may have different views and they need to reach a union opinion efficiently
An experiment conducted by the Beijing University asked two groups of people to discuss the budget of an activity
The first group was asked to discuss in person, while the second group was asked to discuss by email
the 1st group used 30 minutes to reach the agreement on the budget, while it takes 30 hours for the later one
The similar experiment done by other scientist show the same result that people can reach an agreement quickly if they could talk to each other
there will be less conflicts or fight amongst the team members
Writing an email for an informal matter will make that matter looks official
people who receives the email may feel nervous or maybe feel offended by the words in writing
their response will not be recorded and they will not misunderstand the informal discussion to an official claim
if the same words are expressed in talking, the counterparty will feel more relaxed
work in person can indirectly improve the quality and the efficiency of the project
sometimes we have to use emails if the team members are not located in the same place
it is a classroom or campus projects, there is few possibility that the project members are located in different areas
